sub_topic: The Mandelbrot set and its fractal properties
message_1: What is the area of the black region in the Mandelbrot set plot that lies within the square with corners at (-1, -1) and (1, 1)? Round your answer to the nearest hundredth.
message_2: The area of the black region in the Mandelbrot set plot within the square with corners at (-1, -1) and (1, 1) is approximately 1.51 square units. This value is an approximation because the Mandelbrot set has a fractal boundary, which makes it difficult to calculate the exact area.
